item.title: Caeser's Cipher (New Problem)
item.dc:creator: @Goodbye_RS_Hello_RSP Goodbye RS, Hello RSPS
item.description:
@Goodbye_RS_Hello_RSP wrote:

Insanity.

[code]public Cipher(String msg, int off) {

String fin = "";
String[] cip = new String[msg.length()];
String[] almstFin = new String[msg.length()];

for (int i = msg.length() - 1; i > 0; i--) {
	cip[i] = Character.toString(msg.charAt(i));
}

for (int k = cip.length - 1; k > 0; k--) {
	for (int i = alp.length - 1; i > 0; i--) {
		if (cip[k].equalsIgnoreCase(alp[i])) {
			almstFin[k] = alp[i + off];
		}
	}
}

for (int i = almstFin.length - 1; i > 0; i--) {
	fin = fin + almstFin[i];
}

GUI.jTextField3.setText(fin);

}[/code]

item.title: Caeser's Cipher (New Problem)

item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:8, topic:318280”][quote author=lesterknome link=topic=414763.msg3053332#msg3053332 date=1260240494]

for (int i = msg.length() - 1; i > 0; i–)

you tell me

I know it SHOULD work and i already tried, but it does skip it for a reason (ill try again). <---- Fixed, more errors =/

Also is it backwards or wut?
[/quote]

Use your head for a second. If you use i > 0, what will happen when i == 0? The loop won’t run, and it will cut off the 0th character. Change it to >= 0.[/quote]

item.title: Caeser's Cipher (New Problem)
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:7, topic:318280”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=414763.msg3053293#msg3053293 date=1260239105]
for (int i = msg.length() - 1; i > 0; i–)

you tell me

[/quote]

I know it SHOULD work and i already tried, but it does skip it for a reason (ill try again). <---- Fixed, more errors =/

Also is it backwards or wut?[/quote]

Use your head for a second. If you use i > 0, what will happen when i == 0? The loop won’t run, and it will cut off the 0th character. Change it to >= 0.

item.title: Caeser's Cipher (New Problem)
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

public Cipher(String msg, int off) {

            String fin = "";
            String[] cip = new String[msg.length()];
            String[] almstFin = new String[msg.length()];

            for (int i = msg.length() - 1; i > 0; i--) {
                cip[i] = Character.toString(msg.charAt(i));
            }


            for (int k = cip.length - 1; k > 0; k--) {

                for (int i = alp.length - 1; i > 0; i--) {

                    if (cip[k].equalsIgnoreCase(alp[i])) {
                        almstFin[k] = alp[i + off];
                    }

                }

            }

            for (int i = almstFin.length - 1; i > 0; i--) {
                fin = fin + almstFin[i];
            }

            GUI.jTextField3.setText(fin);

    }

apl is a-z

one of the letters is missing, i get null when using a, instead of shifting over to ‘a’ z gives a error. Help please

Read full topic
